Container.Name: public-pool
Container.Overview:
Run your own solo MINING POOL with web UI using public-pool. Connect to your Bitcoin node running anywhere - on the same Unraid server or on another machine in your network.
TIP: For best results, make sure your Bitcoin node's bitcoin.conf has "rpcallowip=" settings that allow connections from this container.
Container.DonateText: If you appreciate my work, then please consider buying me a beer :D

Config.Name: AppData Path (persistent data)
Config.Description: Directory where Public Pool stores shares, stats and worker data.

Config.Name: Database Path
Config.Description: Directory where the SQLite database is stored.

Config.Name: Web UI Port
Config.Description: Port for the web UI. The container uses port 8080 internally.

Config.Name: Bitcoin RPC URL
Config.Description: RPC URL of your Bitcoin node without port (e.g. http://192.168.1.100). This can point to a Bitcoin node running on this Unraid server or on another computer in your network. Make sure the Bitcoin node allows RPC connections from this container in its bitcoin.conf.

Config.Name: Bitcoin RPC Port
Config.Description: RPC port of your Bitcoin node (default: 8332)

Config.Name: Bitcoin ZMQ Host
Config.Description: ZMQ address of your Bitcoin node (e.g. tcp://192.168.1.100:28334). Your bitcoin.conf should have zmqpubrawblock=tcp://0.0.0.0:28334

Config.Name: Pool Identifier
Config.Description: Custom name for your pool (e.g. Home-Pool, Unraid-Pool)

Config.Name: Bitcoin Network
Config.Description: Bitcoin network to use (mainnet or testnet)

Config.Name: Enable HTTPS for API
Config.Description: Set to 'true' to enable HTTPS. Default is 'false' (HTTP only). Enable only if you have a proper reverse proxy or certificate setup. Only enable HTTPS if you know what you're doing.
